properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 2:46PM CST until February 5 at 12:00AM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. For the Winter Weather
Advisory early tonight, light mixed precipitation. A light glaze
and a dusting of snow is possible. Winds gusting as high as 25
mph.

* WHERE...Portions of central, east central and northeast
Missouri and southwest and west central Illinois.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 9 AM Wednesday to 6
AM CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until
midnight CST tonight.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions likely will impact the evening commute on Wednesday
especially.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means that heavy snowfall of
6 inches or more is expected. The rapid accumulation of snow will
make travel extremely difficult, if not impossible. If travel is
necessary, make sure to exercise extreme caution. Begin your
travel with a full tank of gas, and carry a winter storm kit
which includes a shovel, flashlight, cellphone, food and water,
and blankets of extra warm clothing.

A Winter Weather Advisory is issued for a variety of winter
weather conditions, such as snow, blowing snow, sleet, or
freezing drizzle and rain. It only takes a small amount of wintry
precipitation to make roads, bridges, sidewalks, and parking lots
icy and dangerous. It is often difficult to tell when ice begins
to form, so do not be caught off guard.

In Illinois, the latest road conditions can be obtained on the
Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Missouri, the
latest road conditions can be obtained on the Internet at
traveler.modot.org/map/ or by calling 1-888-275-6636.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY
